intro: Gliopsis herbanica, commonly known as the lesser wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, yellow or white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds. Gliopsis herbanica is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
